lead_paragraph: Burnham Pacific Properties Inc. agreed yesterday to acquire the California retail portfolio of Golden State Properties for more than $314 million. Burnham, based in San Diego, is a real estate investment trust. Golden State is a private investment partnership between Highridge Partners of Los Angeles and Blackacre Capital Group L.P. of New York. The 2.7-million-square-foot portfolio consists of 20 retail centers each anchored by a grocery. The deal had an initial value of up to $314 million and a total value of up to $344 million, Burnham said. Under the agreement, Blackacre Capital and Westbrook Partners L.L.C., a private investment fund manager based in New York, will buy $120 million of newly issued Burnham Pacific shares.
